title: Welcoming message
description: Welcome to our Advent Calendar. The video above contains a welcoming message from the Advent project team - we hope you’ll have as much fun with this Advent calendar as we did while preparing and making it. Be blessed!

title: Try this challenge out
description: Happy Friday! This is the first Friday of the last month of the year, so let’s make it count! As you’re spending time with friends preparing for exams/projects, or just hanging out with your colleagues or family members, here’s a fun challenge that you can try to do together - have fun, and be careful!

title: Get Sweatin'!
description: This Advent season, we want you to not only prepare yourselves spiritually, but also physically. Your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit (ref: 1 Cor 6:19) afterall, so get up, stretch, and get sweatin’! Follow the workout on the video above, enjoy!

title: Devotional
subtitle: BibleProject | Advent
description:
This is the first day of the Advent devotional as prepared by BibleProject (available on the YouVersion bible application / website), where it will be a message on Shalom (Peace).
Click [here](https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13255-bibleproject-advent/day/1) to access the resources !

title: May this be a blessing to your eardrums
description: Here’s a Spotify playlist recommendation for the Advent season, each week we will be recommending a new one, so stay tuned!

title: Get to know your ministry teams
description: Our church body consists of many different moving parts, each running various church operations. For this week, we’re getting to know ERT, IPT and Band - whoop!

title: Advent Movie Reccs
description: Try out this movie today with your friends, family or loved ones. Today’s movie recommendation is Star Wars: The Last Jadi - a movie with implications of having hope in darkness. May this movie even remind us of the hope we can have in Christ!

title: Devotional
subtitle: BibleProject | Advent
description: This is the second day of the Advent devotional as prepared by BibleProject (available on the YouVersion bible application / website), where it will be a message on Yakhal (Hope). </br> <ins>[here](https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13255-bibleproject-advent/day/2)</ins> to access the resources !

title: Try this challenge out
description: Happy Friday! Let’s make this one count! As you’re spending time with friends preparing for exams/projects, or just hanging out with your colleagues or family members, here’s a fun challenge that you can try to do together - have fun, be careful, and get creative!

title: Get Sweatin'!
description: Week 2 of some Advent workouts - cmon now, don’t be lazy, let’s get crazy (with the workouts, hah!) Enjoy this week’s workout!

title: Encouragements
description: For this Sunday, a fun video from Pastor Bo! You don't want to miss this!

title: May this be a blessing to your eardrums
description: Here’s a Spotify playlist recommendation for the Advent season, each week we will be recommending a new one, so stay tuned!

title: Get to know your ministry teams
description: Our church body consists of many different moving parts, each running various church operations. For this week, we’re getting to know CW, BB, MM and VP - whoop!

title: Advent Movie Reccs
description: Try out this movie today with your friends, family or loved ones. Today’s movie recommendation is Paddington 2, and this move considers how joy spreads to others when live lovingly and selflessly. May His love be evident in how we conduct ourselves and treat others!

title: Devotional
subtitle: BibleProject | Advent
description: This is the third day of the Advent devotional as prepared by BibleProject (available on the YouVersion bible application / website), where it will be a message on Chara (Joy). </br> <ins>[here](https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13255-bibleproject-advent/day/3)</ins> to access the resources !

title: Try this challenge out
description: Happy Friday! At this point you might have exhausted all reels / tiktok related challenges already, so here’s a fun recipe that you can try with your friends and/or family members. There’s many other holiday recipes out there - check them out, and try it out!

title: Get Sweatin'!
description: Week 3 of the holidays workout challenge - hopefully you’ve started noticing some holiday gains, and inviting other people to sweat long with you. Do it up!

title: Encouragements
description: For the last Sunday of this Advent Calendar, a fun video from Pastor Bo, you also don’t want to miss this!

title: May this be a blessing to your eardrums
description: Here’s a Spotify playlist recommendation for the Advent season, each week we will be recommending a new one, so stay tuned!

title: Get to know your Ministry Teams
description: Our church body consists of many different moving parts, each running various church operations. For this week, we’re getting to know Host, t3ch and AV - whoop!

title: Advent Movie Reccs
description: Today’s movie recommendation is Ben is Back, which movie’s tragic elements are superseded by its moving illustration of the grace that Christ’s birth, death, and resurrection give to us, and the fierce love that brought that grace into being.

title: Devotional
subtitle: BibleProject | Advent
description: This is the fourth, and final day of the Advent devotional as prepared by BibleProject (available on the YouVersion bible application / website), where it will be a message on Agape (Love). </br> <ins>[here](https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13255-bibleproject-advent/day/4)</ins> to access the resources !

title: Try this challenge out
description: Happy Friday! Two days out to Christmas, and apart from gifts, cards are normally exchanged too! It’s the perfect medium for us to reach out to friends: old and new, far and near... even family members too! If you’re out of ideas or in need of some, here’s a video that might be helpful - have fun, and share the love!

title: Get Sweatin'!
description: Last Advent workout session, and this also brings us to the last day of the Advent calendar. We hope you’ve enjoyed the content and challenges on the calendar so far. We hope you’ve been able to share this joy with others around you too! Tonight’s Christmas Eve - so let’s look forward to that, and commemorate the birth of Jesus.
